attributes.name: Microsoft 365 Teams Custom Application Interaction Allowed v101.0.0
attributes.description: Identifies when custom applications are allowed in Microsoft Teams. If an organization requires applications other than those available in the Teams app store, custom applications can be developed as packages and uploaded. An adversary may abuse this behavior to establish persistence in an environment.
author: Elastic
false_positives: Custom applications may be allowed by a system or network administrator. Verify that the configuration change was expected. Exceptions can be added to this rule to filter expected behavior.
attributes.query:
event.dataset:o365.audit and event.provider:MicrosoftTeams and
event.category:web and event.action:TeamsTenantSettingChanged and
o365.audit.Name:"Allow sideloading and interaction of custom apps" and
o365.audit.NewValue:True and event.outcome:success
attributes.setup: The Office 365 Logs Fleet integration, Filebeat module, or similarly structured data is required to be compatible with this rule.
